TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DocumentsContract extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Defines the contract between a documents provider and the platform.

remarks.para: Defines the contract between a documents provider and the platform.
To create a document provider, extend , which provides a foundational implementation of this contract.
All client apps must hold a valid URI permission grant to access documents, typically issued when a user makes a selection through , , or .

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Net.Uri BuildChildDocumentsUri (string authority, string parentDocumentId);
.method public static hidebysig class Android.Net.Uri BuildChildDocumentsUri(string authority, string parentDocumentId) cil managed

Docs.param: the document to return children for, which must be a directory with MIME type of .
Docs.summary: Build URI representing the children of the target directory in a document provider.

remarks.para: Build URI representing the children of the target directory in a document provider. When queried, a provider will return zero or more rows with columns defined by .

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Net.Uri BuildChildDocumentsUriUsingTree (Android.Net.Uri treeUri, string parentDocumentId);
.method public static hidebysig class Android.Net.Uri BuildChildDocumentsUriUsingTree(class Android.Net.Uri treeUri, string parentDocumentId) cil managed

Docs.param: the subtree to leverage to gain access to the target document. The target directory must be a descendant of this subtree.
the document to return children for, which the caller may not have direct access to, and which must be a directory with MIME type of .
Docs.summary: Build URI representing the children of the target directory in a document provider.

remarks.para: Build URI representing the children of the target directory in a document provider. When queried, a provider will return zero or more rows with columns defined by .

However, instead of directly accessing the target directory, the returned URI will leverage access granted through a subtree URI, typically returned by . The target directory must be a descendant (child, grandchild, etc) of the subtree.
This is typically used to access documents under a user-selected directory tree, since it doesn't require the user to separately confirm each new document access.

.method public static hidebysig class Android.Net.Uri BuildDocumentUriUsingTree(class Android.Net.Uri treeUri, string documentId) cil managed

Docs.param: the subtree to leverage to gain access to the target document. The target directory must be a descendant of this subtree.
the target document, which the caller may not have direct access to.
Docs.summary: Build URI representing the target in a document provider.

remarks.para: Build URI representing the target in a document provider. When queried, a provider will return a single row with columns defined by .

However, instead of directly accessing the target document, the returned URI will leverage access granted through a subtree URI, typically returned by . The target document must be a descendant (child, grandchild, etc) of the subtree.
This is typically used to access documents under a user-selected directory tree, since it doesn't require the user to separately confirm each new document access.

MemberSignature.Value: public const string ExtraError;
.field public static literal string ExtraError

Docs.summary: Optional string included in a directory providing an error message that should be shown to a user.

remarks.para: Optional string included in a directory providing an error message that should be shown to a user. For example, a provider may wish to indicate that a network error occurred. The user may choose to retry, resulting in a new query.

MemberSignature.Value: public const string ExtraInfo;
.field public static literal string ExtraInfo

Docs.summary: Optional string included in a directory providing an informational message that should be shown to a user.

remarks.para: Optional string included in a directory providing an informational message that should be shown to a user. For example, a provider may wish to indicate that not all documents are available.

MemberSignature.Value: public const string ExtraLoading;
.field public static literal string ExtraLoading

Docs.summary: Optional boolean flag included in a directory indicating that a document provider is still loading data.

remarks.para: Optional boolean flag included in a directory indicating that a document provider is still loading data. For example, a provider has returned some results, but is still waiting on an outstanding network request. The provider must send a content changed notification when loading is finished.

Docs.param: document to return thumbnail for, which must have set.
optimal thumbnail size desired. A provider may return a thumbnail of a different size, but never more than double the requested size.
signal used to indicate if caller is no longer interested in the thumbnail.
Docs.summary: Return thumbnail representing the document at the given URI.

remarks.para: Return thumbnail representing the document at the given URI. Callers are responsible for their own in-memory caching.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Net.Uri RenameDocument (Android.Content.ContentResolver resolver, Android.Net.Uri documentUri, string displayName);
.method public static hidebysig class Android.Net.Uri RenameDocument(class Android.Content.ContentResolver resolver, class Android.Net.Uri documentUri, string displayName) cil managed

Docs.summary: Change the display name of an existing document.

remarks.para: Change the display name of an existing document.

If the underlying provider needs to create a new to represent the updated display name, that new document is returned and the original document is no longer valid. Otherwise, the original document is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override IntPtr ThresholdClass { get; }
.property instance native int ThresholdClass

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
